data.text:
@FreeRangeKids @CHSommers @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Poor boys and men today.
They don't know if it's right or wrong  to hold a door open for a girl or woman.
Go ahead , hold it open for them.
Don't let these confused people confuse you.
@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY So Jim Acosta has to go to the magazine stand to get his magazine.
@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Or maybe you now can see the power of "politically correct". It worked for Stalin and Mao too. #LeftRightParadigmIsTheTrap
@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY What?!  (Not that I read Cosmo or shop at Walmart but I’m still confused.)
@austinruse @FreeRangeKids @CHSommers @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Well I guess anybody can get a blue check by their name nowadays
@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Gotta make room for Guns and Ammo mags
@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Wtf does Cosmo being sold at Walmart have to do with people not understanding #Consent
@FreeRangeKids @stfuregressives @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Reminds me of when the Columbine backlash extended to RL Stine and Goosebumps was taken off library shelves.
@scareduck @FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Ah, thanks!
@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY N.b. this NPR story says @Cosmopolitan is getting yanked from the checkout line but implies it might be sold elsewhere. Attn @CathyYoung63
@primalpoly @FreeRangeKids @nikitakarachoi @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY They won't. They'll change it and be complimented doing so. If.
@Cy_Guy @FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY @Walmart Maybe. Still asinine.

@FreeRangeKids @charlesthomas @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY I think this a bone to the Extreme Right because they limited some gun sales after #Parkdale so now @Walmart feels like they have to appease #Trumpers by stopping sales something they want banned.
@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Walmart has expertise in its own rack marketing. Let it ride.
@bethrenaldi @FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Indeed
@FreeRangeKids @charlesthomas @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY I bet Walmart isn't removing tabloids like the National Enquirer and The Globe from checkout lines and those are way worse than Cosmo.
@fategggringo @FreeRangeKids @CHSommers @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY I agree on that
@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY But it is good publicity for both Cosmo and Wal Mart.
@freerangekids your Tweet was quoted in an article by @BuzzFeed  https://t.co/mxixTF1uhp
@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY What's adolescence without secretly taking a PG-13 quiz from your mother's @Cosmopolitan?
@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Just happy not having to explain "15  ways to have a mind-blowing orgasm!" to my small children.  It's simply a recovery of DECENCY and not panic at all.

@fategggringo @FreeRangeKids @CHSommers @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Actually it is about power over someone. Violating someone sexually is the ultimate power trip. Now do some people use sex to gain power.....

@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY WM has dealt with complaints on Cosmo from their customers for years. And have used U blinders to cover the tag lines for years to. This next step was a logical move given the heightened sensitivity we are currently in. Not defending it, just saying that is the reality.
@FreeRangeKids @CHSommers @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Panic blender.  I like that.  Can I use that or have you copywrited it?

@RRLove16 @FreeRangeKids @EdMorrissey @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY U could easily fix this by changing the type of stand it sits in. Have a covered type stand where only see magazine name. Other magazines are just as racy and kids can also read some of the stupid story lines that parents have to explain that can be uncomfortable.  Same deal

@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY The politics of it are weird, but I agree with the absolute action. Cosmo in checkout aisles is one piece of how children learn that women are objects whose only value is in their looks. Now let's remove the gossip rags too :-)
@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Panicing is fun though. https://t.co/SjCc8cUumr
@RRLove16 @primalpoly @FreeRangeKids @EdMorrissey @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Are you sexualizing children? Creep!
@FreeRangeKids @CHSommers @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Panic Blender! I love it!
@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY The same knee jerk reaction of an over zealous system we have done with laws.

@FreeRangeKids @nikitakarachoi @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Retail chains are caving to a classic sex-negative moral panic. It's the worst kind of neo-Victorian prudery, and they'll be embarrassed by it within a decade.
@RRLove16 @FreeRangeKids @EdMorrissey @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Breast-fed children usually have a fair amount of experience with boobs at eye level. Why should they be traumatized? We're all mammals.
@FreeRangeKids @EdMorrissey @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Discretion has been criminalized.
@Tomoteras @RRLove16 @camcamyeg @FreeRangeKids @EdMorrissey @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Stop suggesting that people are responsible for their own choices an actions.  That scares progressives.

@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Puritanical religious extremists will be proud of this decision.

Now, on to banning alcohol, because that has worked so well in the past!
@YourLocalJacob @FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Unavoidable really. Next up are sex fantasies and fetishes.
@FreeRangeKids @CHSommers @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY It's like the opioid flap.  There seems to be no intermediate setting between "ignore" and "panic".
@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY This is actually great news.
@FreeRangeKids @CHSommers @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY 👍👍👍

@FreeRangeKids @CHSommers @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY But didn't you know? You ladies are all pristine figurines carved of crystal on high gleaming pedestals and sex is...icky, it makes us feel "things" & the thought of goddesses enjoying sex is triggering, b/c that means our mothers, sisters, daughters have sex & like it too.
@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Damn they've even thrown the category 'women' in the panic blender....

@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY I think #metoo became about things other than assault and harassment as soon as it started trending and became mainstream. Now it’s about power over social interactions.
@FreeRangeKids @Cosmopolitan @USATODAY Cosmo helped whip the mob into this frenzy. Enjoy the bitter fruit.
